intro: Distephanus streptocladus, commonly known as the red-flowered daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking red petals and yellow centers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Distephanus streptocladus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
